alert.note: Alert for West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 24 at 2:43PM PDT until August 25 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT FRIDAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AS WELL AS DRY AND UNSTABLE CONDITIONS FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONE 659... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zone 659 West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet. * WINDS...East 10 to 15 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. Relative humidity values may be even lower in areas of zone 659 that are most exposed to easterly winds. * THUNDERSTORMS...A chance of thunderstorms is in the forecast for early Friday morning. Thunderstorms would be moving from south to north and have the highest likelihood of occurring in the southern section of zone 659 between 5AM and 11AM Friday morning. Dry thunderstorms are possible in the northern section of zone 659. * OUTFLOW WINDS...Gusty and erratic winds are possible in the immediate vicinity of any thunderstorms that develop. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 70s and 80s. * HAINES...Mid-level Haines Index 6 or high potential for large plume dominated fire growth. * IMPACTS...A dry and unstable air mass with warm temperatures can contribute to active fire behavior. In western Washington, significant growth on existing fires takes place under such conditions. If a fire were to begin, air quality may diminish in the surrounding area.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either imminent or occurring now. Any fires that develop will likely spread quickly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.

area.areaDesc: West Slopes of the Central Cascades Generally above 1500 Feet
